Step 6: Test filtering by category
Step 7: Test search functionality

description: Exercise endpoints: Create custom exercises for users

description: Workout logging: Create new workout session and add exercises

description: Workout endpoints: Update existing workout

description: Workout endpoints: Delete workout

description: e1RM calculation: Implement Epley formula for estimated 1RM
steps: Step 1: Create e1RM calculation function using Epley formula: weight * (1 + reps/30)
Step 2: Apply to all sets when workout is logged
Step 3: Store calculated e1RM in sets table
Step 4: Test with various weight/rep combinations
Step 5: Verify calculation accuracy
Step 6: Test edge cases (1 rep, high reps)

description: e1RM calculation: Support multiple formulas (Brzycki, Wathan, Lombardi)
steps: Step 1: Implement Brzycki formula: weight * (36 / (37 - reps))
Step 2: Implement Wathan formula: 100 * weight / (48.8 + 53.8 * e^(-0.075 * reps))
Step 3: Implement Lombardi formula: weight * reps^0.1
Step 4: Create formula selector based on user preference
Step 5: Test each formula with known values
Step 6: Verify formulas produce reasonable results
Step 7: Allow user to switch formula in profile settings

description: Analytics: Get exercise trend data showing e1RM progression over time
steps: Step 1: Create GET /analytics/exercise/{id}/trend endpoint
Step 2: Calculate weekly best e1RM for given exercise
Step 3: Calculate 4-week rolling average
Step 4: Determine trend direction (improving/stable/regressing)
Step 5: Calculate percentage change over specified period
Step 6: Return time series data for charting
Step 7: Test with exercise that has multiple workouts
Step 8: Test with different time ranges
Step 9: Verify calculations are accurate
Step 10: Test with insufficient data returns appropriate response

description: Analytics: Get complete set history for an exercise
steps: Step 1: Create GET /analytics/exercise/{id}/history endpoint
Step 2: Return all sets for given exercise ordered by date
Step 3: Include weight, reps, RPE, RIR, e1RM
Step 4: Group by workout session
Step 5: Test with exercise that has long history
Step 6: Verify data is complete and ordered correctly

description: Analytics: Calculate strength percentiles based on bodyweight, age, and sex
steps: Step 1: Create GET /analytics/percentiles endpoint
Step 2: Get user's current max e1RM for tracked lifts
Step 3: Fetch user's bodyweight, age, sex from profile
Step 4: Calculate bodyweight multiplier (e1RM / bodyweight)
Step 5: Compare to population standards database
Step 6: Determine percentile rank (0-100)
Step 7: Assign classification label (Beginner/Novice/Intermediate/Advanced/Elite)
Step 8: Test with various user profiles
Step 9: Verify percentiles are reasonable
Step 10: Test with missing profile data handles gracefully

description: PR detection: Automatically detect and record e1RM PRs
steps: Step 1: After each workout, check if any e1RM exceeds previous best
Step 2: Create PR record with type=e1rm, value, and date
Step 3: Associate PR with exercise and user
Step 4: Test logging workout that sets new e1RM PR
Step 5: Verify PR is recorded in prs table
Step 6: Test logging workout that doesn't exceed PR

description: PR detection: Automatically detect and record rep PRs

Step 2: Create PR record with type=rep_pr, weight, reps, and date
Step 3: Test setting rep PR with same weight, more reps
Step 4: Verify rep PR is recorded
Step 5: Test with first time performing exercise
Step 6: Verify first time is considered a PR

description: Analytics: Get all PRs for user with filtering options
